page.title: 15Good Old Days
page.content: Although school was not his favourite place Mr. Coombes always tried hard to do his work perfectly because he knew what would happen if he made any mistakes!To prepare for this the boys would hammer a nail into the cane so any extra hard hit would cause it to shatter.As well as attending school by the age of ten Mr. Combes was working for the local doctors.Before school he would do anything they required and in the evening he would return to heat the water for the doctor's bath.Light would come from oil lamps and candles while cooking was done over a wood burning stove.A good joint of meat could be had for 6 pence and a pair of pig's skin boots which would cost Â£30 these days would cost a few shillings.
